questions.question: She played the violin ................................
questions.description: We need an adverb to modify the verb played.

questions.question: Why are you talking so .................................?
questions.description: Loudly is an adverb. We need an adverb to modify the verb talking.

questions.question: The radio is too ................................. I can't focus on my work.
questions.description: Only adjectives, nouns and pronouns can be used as the complement of be.

questions.question: A ................................... learner can grasp this easily.
questions.description: Quick is an adjective. We need an adjective to modify the noun leaner.

questions.question: The intelligent boy grasped everything ...................................
questions.description: Quickly is an adverb. We need an adverb to modify the verb grasped.

questions.question: She spoke so ................................. that I could not understand anything.
questions.description: The adjective and adverb form of fast is fast.

questions.question: I know them quite ..............................
questions.description: We need the adverb well to modify the verb know.

questions.question: She is a ....................................... friend of mine.
questions.description: The adjective good modifies the noun friend.

questions.question: I have been watching a lot of movies .................................
He is a ....................................... actor.
questions.description: We use adjective fabulous to modify the noun actor.
